body_html:
I realize I also failed to chime in:

  • logging doesn't show up by default in Jupyter unless a user calls something like logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO) themselves. This is the same "users won't see info logs unless they opt in" that matches @taion's expectations above.

  • @taion you're right that "I see INFO logs by default" is an unusual default in the outside world. As you can probably guess, it's the common default inside Google.

I'm with @vrv that (3) is probably the best choice. I'm generally against (1) since I find the warnings module pretty cumbersome.

@taion you're right that "I see INFO logs by default" is an unusual default in the outside world. As you can probably guess, it's the common default inside Google.


I'm with @vrv that (3) is probably the best choice. I'm generally against (1) since I find the warnings module pretty cumbersome.
body:
I realize I also failed to chime in: 

* logging doesn't show up by default in Jupyter unless a user calls something like `logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)` themselves. This is the same "users won't see info logs unless they opt in" that matches @taion's expectations above.

* @taion you're right that "I see INFO logs by default" is an unusual default in the outside world. As you can probably guess, it's the common default *inside* Google.

I'm with @vrv that (3) is probably the best choice. I'm generally against (1) since I find the `warnings` module pretty cumbersome.
